sense.name: Physically or metaphorically emit rays, as of light or energy.
sense.examples: The sun radiates heat. The sun is radiating. The metal radiated radioactive energy.

sense.name: Issue or emerge in rays or waves.
sense.examples: Heat radiated from the box. The scent radiated from his corner of the room. Light radiated brilliantly.

sense.name: Physically extend or spread outward from a center or focus or inward towards a center; physically spread from a start point.
sense.examples: Spokes radiate from the hub of the wheel. These plants radiate spines in all directions. The new species radiated from the center of the island outwards.

sense.name: Have a complexion with a strong bright color; reflect emotion via one's complexion.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[source[animate]] RADIATE PP NP1[source[animate]] RADIATE ADVP[temporal] Note: [animate] here refers both to animate agents ('she') and features of animate agents ('her face').
sense.examples: Her face radiated when she came out of the sauna. She was radiating with joy. Her face radiated with happiness.
